title: 2.5 Implement heartbeat mechanism
description:
Implement PING/PONG heartbeat to detect dead connections.

## Server Side
- Start heartbeat interval (30s) for each client after registration
- Send PING message to client
- Expect PONG response within 5 seconds
- Update lastHeartbeat on PONG receipt
- Mark client as disconnected if no PONG after 90s

## Client Side
- Respond to PING with PONG immediately
- Include timestamp in PONG

## Message Format
```json
{ "type": "PING", "timestamp": "..." }
{ "type": "PONG", "timestamp": "..." }
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Server sends PING every 30 seconds
- Client responds with PONG within 5 seconds
- Server updates lastHeartbeat on PONG
- Stale connections detected after 90s of no PONG

## Blocked By
- 2.4 (registration must work first)

title: 2.4 Implement client registration protocol
description:
Implement the REGISTER/REGISTER_ACK message exchange.

## Server Side (websocket-server.js)
- Handle REGISTER message from client
- Check if clientId already exists in registry
- If exists: send REGISTER_ACK with success=false
- If new: add to registry, send REGISTER_ACK with success=true

## Client Side (websocket-client.js)
- Send REGISTER message on connection open
- Include clientId and metadata (version, hostname, platform)
- Handle REGISTER_ACK response
- Log registration result

## Message Format
```json
// Client -> Server
{ "type": "REGISTER", "clientId": "restaurant-001", "timestamp": "...", "metadata": {...} }

// Server -> Client
{ "type": "REGISTER_ACK", "success": true/false, "message": "...", "timestamp": "..." }
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Client sends REGISTER on connect
- Server responds with REGISTER_ACK
- Duplicate clientId rejected with success=false
- Both sides log registration result

## Blocked By
- 1.4 (protocol constants)
- 2.1 (WebSocket server)
- 2.2 (client registry)
- 2.3 (WebSocket client)

title: 2.6 Implement client auto-reconnect
description:
Implement automatic reconnection with exponential backoff.

## Implementation Details
- On WebSocket 'close' or 'error', start reconnection
- Use exponential backoff: 5s, 7.5s, 11.25s, ... up to 60s max
- Formula: min(RECONNECT_INTERVAL * (1.5 ^ attempt), 60000)
- Limit attempts to MAX_RECONNECT_ATTEMPTS (default 10)
- On successful reconnect, re-register with server

## State Machine
```
CONNECTED -> DISCONNECTED -> RECONNECTING -> CONNECTED
                                    |
                                    v
                              FAILED (max attempts)
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Client attempts reconnect on disconnect
- Delays follow exponential pattern up to 60s
- Max attempts honored
- Logs each reconnect attempt with delay
- Successful reconnect triggers re-registration

## Blocked By
- 2.3 (needs WebSocket client)
